summary: Iteration 16 - Field Registry Feature Testing: All features working correctly. Backend APIs (21/21 tests passed) and Frontend UI fully functional with module/entity selection, Kanban stages, form fields, and list display configuration.

success_rate.frontend: 100% - All Field Registry UI features verified

seed_data_creation: None - uses default configurations from backend
context_for_next_testing_agent: Field Registry feature is fully functional. It provides metadata-driven field configuration for all modules (CRM, Inventory, Accounts, Production, Procurement, HRMS). CRM module has 4 entities (Leads, Accounts, Quotations, Samples) with Leads having 9 Kanban stages and 20 form fields across 4 sections (Basic Info, Address, Classification, Follow-up). Admin-only access is enforced.

entity_selector.details: Entity selector updates based on selected module

kanban_stages_tab.details: Shows 9 stages for Leads entity with color badges and drag handles

form_fields_tab.details: Shows 20 fields organized by sections with Required badges and field type indicators

list_display_tab.details: Shows checkboxes for all 20 fields to configure list view display

save_changes_button.details: Button becomes enabled when changes are made, shows 'Unsaved Changes' badge

admin_access_restriction.details: Non-admin users receive 403 error when trying to save configuration

backend_api_modules.details: Returns all 6 modules with labels and entities

backend_api_config_leads.details: Returns leads configuration with 9 stages and 20 fields

backend_api_masters.details: Returns list of master types (customer, supplier, item, etc.)

backend_api_save_config.details: Saves configuration successfully for admin users

field_registry_architecture.description: Metadata-driven field configuration system for all modules
